page.title: 07 COMMUNICATIONS
page.content: Alongside the north-western boundary of Beguildy School is the Beguildy Telephone Exchange which was modernised in 1979 to cope with the increasing number of subscribers in the Beguildy area. Every number on the Beguildy exchange is a three-figure number beginning with the figure 2 or the figure 6. There are 152 subscribers on the Beguildy exchange. There are five lines to Knighton so five different people can ring Knighton from Beguildy at the same time. Sixteen people on the Beguildy exchange can speak to each other at the same time. In a power failure all the telephones are automatically switched to batteries in the exchange. All calls made by Beguildy subscribers are metered at the exchange. Mail is delivered up the valley once a day and collected twice.
